us.thetaco.survivalgames.clockwork

Class ArenaTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.thetaco.survivalgames.clockwork.ArenaTimer

  • public class ArenaTimer
extends java.lang.Object
    A class specifically for handing arena timings etc.
    Author:
    activates

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArenaTimer

        public ArenaTimer(SurvivalGames plugin)

    • Method Detail

      • startArenaTimer

        public void startArenaTimer(java.lang.String arenaName,
                            int startTime,
                            int gameTime)
        The method to start the real "game." Here you define the arena name, the time till the game starts (like the ready set go etc), then how long the game will last
        Parameters:
        arenaName - The name of the arena to start.. If the lobby is still active this will not run
        startTime - The time till the game starts
        gameTime - The actually time the game lasts

      • gameStarted

        public boolean gameStarted(java.lang.String arenaName)
        A method for determining if an arena's game is actually started, yet. If not, chances are the timer section could be active
        Parameters:
        arenaName - The arena in question
        Returns:
        Will return true if the game is active and started

      • startTimerRunning

        public boolean startTimerRunning(java.lang.String arenaName)
        A method used to check and see if the timer is active and running
        Parameters:
        arenaName - The arena in question
        Returns:
        Will return true if the timer is active, but the game has not been started

      • gameTimerRunning

        public boolean gameTimerRunning(java.lang.String arenaName)
        A method used to check and see if the timer is active and running for the game
        Parameters:
        arenaName - The arena in question
        Returns:
        Will return true if the timer is active and that the game is running (in theory)

      • cancelStartTimer

        public void cancelStartTimer(java.lang.String arenaName)
        Used to cancel the start timer.. Either if the match has been cancelled, or if the match has been started and the timer is no longer needed
        Parameters:
        arenaName - The name of the arena to stop the start timer

      • cancelGameTimer

        public void cancelGameTimer(java.lang.String arenaName)
        Used to cancel the game timer.. Either if the match has been cancelled, or if the match has been started and the timer is no longer needed
        Parameters:
        arenaName - The name of the arena to stop the start timer

      • getCurrentStartTime

        public int getCurrentStartTime(java.lang.String arenaName)
        Used to retrieve the current start time interval. It is done in this method to prevent null pointer exceptions
        Parameters:
        arenaName - The name of the arena to retrieve the current start time
        Returns:
        The current interval of the timer.. It will be zero if it is disabled

      • getCurrentGameTime

        public int getCurrentGameTime(java.lang.String arenaName)
        Used to retrieve the current game time interval. It is done in this method to prevent null pointer exceptions
        Parameters:
        arenaName - The name of the arena to retrieve the current game time
        Returns:
        The current interval of the timer. If it is zero, the game is not active

      • clearCurrentStartTime

        public void clearCurrentStartTime(java.lang.String arenaName)
        Used to clear the actually incrementing start timer, not the start timer ID
        Parameters:
        arenaName - The arena to stop the start timer in

      • removeScoreboard

        public void removeScoreboard(java.lang.String arenaName)
        Used to remove the scoreboard from all players in the arena. Only useful when closing the arena
        Parameters:
        arenaName - The name of the arena that all scoreboards need to removed in

      • removeScoreboard

        public void removeScoreboard(org.bukkit.entity.Player p)
        Used to remove the scoreboard from a specific players. (Mainly used after they die)
        Parameters:
        p - The player that the scoreboard will be removed on

      • restoreInventories

        public void restoreInventories(java.lang.String arenaName)
        A method simply for restoring the inventories to all the players within a particular arena
        Parameters:
        arenaName - The arena to restore all the player's inventories in

      • closeGame

        public void closeGame(java.lang.String arenaName)
        A method solely for closing the game. It is in charge of teleporting players to a specified end-zone
        Parameters:
        arenaName - The arena name that should be closed
